author: RNN Staff
title: 'Slave collar,' pirate ship sailing back to store, CA mom says
text:
(RNN) - A California mother is calling a toy pirate ship containing a dark-skinned character with a “slave collar” that her son received as a present a “racist toy.”
“It’s a racist piece,” Ida Lockett told CBS TV Sacramento about the Playmobil Pirate Ship she said her son’s aunt bought from Toys R Us . “It’s a racist toy.”
Lockett wants the store to scuttle the 176-piece toy set, which Toys R Us was offering for $62.99 online Thursday, marked down from $89.99.
“I’m going to ask to speak to the manager, and I’m going to ask him not to support this particular product,” Lockett told CBS TV Sacramento reporter Derek Shore .
The “slave collar,” as she described a piece for the neck of what she called a “dark-skinned” character, who had no shoes and had tattered clothes, sparked her anger.
She said she had spent the weekend assembling the set for her son’s fifth birthday.
“He was excited when he got it,” she said, and she said she was happy for her son.
Then, Lockett said, she noticed her son playing with a collar for the neck of a character.
"You cannot have this particular piece of accessory and call it anything else,” she said. “It’s a slave collar.”
She said the ship comes with a dungeon and racist toy instructions.
“It told my son to put the slave cuff around the black character’s neck,” she said, “and then to play with the toy.”
Neither Playmobil nor Toys R Us responded to multiple requests for comment, CBS TV Sacramento said.
Playmobil, however, did give The Washington Post a statement that said the toy portrayed life on a 17th-century pirate ship.
"If you look at the box, you can see that the pirate figure is clearly a crew member on the pirate ship and not a captive," Playmobil told the Post . "The figure was meant to represent a pirate who was a former slave in a historical context. It was not our intention to offend anyone in any way."
Stephen Webb, the president of the Sacramento (CA) NAACP, a civil rights organization, told the station: “This is deplorable. This cannot be accepted. It needs to be pulled off the shelf.”
